Weather to change in Rajasthan from Feb 17, rain alert:Intense heat likely during day, temperature crossed 30 degrees Celsius in February
- Copy link
A Western Disturbance will be active in Rajasthan on February 17-18, which may cause clouds to cover areas in Jaipur and Bikaner division, with light rain possible in some places.
Meanwhile, in Barmer, the maximum daytime temperature reached 35 degrees on Saturday. Weather experts say such temperatures in Barmer are normally recorded only after February 20. In the last 24 hours, the sky remained clear with strong sunshine from morning till late evening.
These cities also had warm days
According to the Jaipur Weather Center report, Jaisalmer, Jodhpur, Phalodi, Bikaner, Churu, Nagaur, Chittorgarh, Jalore, Lunkaransar, Pali and Dungarpur also experienced warmth during the day. Here, the maximum temperature has already reached between 30 to 33 degrees Celsius in February.
Intense cold in Shekhawati during morning-evening
Although days have started getting warm in the state's cities, the Shekhawati area still experiences intense cold during morning and evening. The coldest area was recorded in Fatehpur at 4.5 degrees Celsius. Sikar recorded a minimum temperature of 6.5 degrees Celsius.
Weather will change again
Meteorological Center Jaipur Director Radheshyam Sharma said, “The weather will remain clear in the state till February 16. There will be sunshine during the day, while mild cold in the morning and evening.”
A western disturbance will become active in the state on February 17. Due to the effect of this system, clouds may cover areas in Jaipur and Bikaner division on February 17 and 18, and there may be light rain.
